website_summaries.verdict: The Reebok CrossFit Speed TR 2.0 received very high marks from the athletes for its versatility. This well-rounded shoe was considered one of the best CrossFit trainers for running. At the same time, it offered ample support and stability for weightlifting, rope climbing, and plyometrics. Its grip, flexibility, and style were also among the highlighted advantages.However, durability issues held the trainer back from becoming the absolute favorite for some customers. Nevertheless, a vast majority marveled at the comfort and performance it offered for the price.
pros: Numerous training buffs found the Reebok CrossFit Speed TR 2.0 suitable for all sorts of workouts, including CrossFit WODs
The firmness of the heel was appreciated by a majority of athletes
it made them feel stable when lifting weights
A great number of athletes praised the RopePro technology for withstanding rigorous rope climbs
Based on multiple reviews, the trainer delivered excellent grip on various surfaces
The shoe was flexible enough to accommodate multi-directional foot movements, according to many wearers
It was also described as light and airy by most buyers
A handful of purchasers raved about the stylish look and colors of the footwear
cons: A number of users reported that the synthetic overlays started peeling off the upper after only a few weeks of moderate use
People with wide foot dimensions were not able to achieve a comfortable fit
Several wearers complained about the heel as it caused discomfort for some and accidental shoe slips for others

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable with good support
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for durability, light, support, fit, comfort and overall functionality. I use them for boot camp and warm-up jogs. Lots of burpees, kettlebell stuff, bear crawls, etc. Well, I chose the color so I probably shouldn't complain, but this is not a good color (neony blue). There's a reason it was cheaper. This is my 2nd purchase of this model shoe. Like the last time, they stain easily. My work outs sometimes go through fields so I don't know if it's some plant material or just sweat, but both pairs become quickly stained.
customer_reviews.author: Springfield VA Dad

customer_reviews.title: Secure fit at the ankles, great tread grip, very stable.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve noticed a clear improvement in my stability while executing compound exercises, specifically during heavy leg movements. The shoes have a ton of grip and fit very close at the ankle, which is where I assume the increased stability comes from. I have yet to try running in them, though I did notice that the shoes tore open the skin on my Achilles while walking one day—my socks were slightly too short to cover the part where my ankle met the shoe. Once wearing socks tall enough, these shoes should do fine for anyone who needs a set of cross trainers that can support both casual powerlifting and short/medium distance runs.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron R. Parvini

customer_reviews.title: These are by far my favorite Crossfit shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've had metcons (1st ones) and nanos (2 and 5). These are by far my favorite Crossfit shoe. I do mostly short runs, tabatas, and light weight hi-rep olympic lifts. I do not lift heavy very often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good fit for me
customer_reviews.text: Nice footwear for training. My feet are somewhat on the narrow side, usually i wear nikes. I have a pair of nike zooms in 11.5 but i had to go down to 10.5 for these (Dicks only had 10's). You might struggle if you have wider feet.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Solid.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for running, very stable for lifts in a metcon. Much more narrow than a Nano.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These fit great and are so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: First time buying the Speed TR's. I have two pairs of nanao's and wanted to try something new. These fit great and are so comfortable. I've even wore them out while im not at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M. Lightfoot

customer_reviews.title: Very similar to nano 8. Slightly smaller toe box
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and similar to my nano 8s just with a slightly smaller toe box. Squats and lifting still just fine. I wear a 10 in the nano 8s but a 9 in these which I found odd. Overal, pretty comfortable and similar to the nano 8!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Built for narrow feet.
customer_reviews.text: Normally wear size 11. Ordered 11.5. Way too narrow in the toe box. Shoe was very tight all over. But, nice looking shoe and was looking forward to wearing them for CrossFit workouts. Had to send them back and am looking for a brand that has a "wide" option. If you have a "normal" foot, you will probably like them.
customer_reviews.author: Irondoor

customer_reviews.title: and in my opinion they're pretty much the perfect gym shoe
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a pair of these at Dick's Sporting Goods, and in my opinion they're pretty much the perfect gym shoe. Firm where you need them to be, flexible enough for short runs, durable outsole. I liked the fit better than Nike Metcons or Reebok Nanos. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeemaker

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, I wear them for fitness and just walking around the city.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Wester

product_meta.title: Reebok Men's Crossfit Speed TR 2.0 Cross-Trainer Shoe
product_meta.description: Speed meets durability in the Reebok CrossFit speed TR 2.0. The cordura upper is tough, and the exposed heel clip increases stability. The soft eva midsole is responsive, and ropepro on the sole adds grip.
